1.name: Sylvan Wood
1.desc: The most basic type of wood which can be found everywhere across all kingdoms. Used for crafting simple and makeshift tools.

2.name: Birch Wood
2.desc: Known for its durability and natural resistance to decay. Used for crafting items that require a bit more resilience.

3.name: Ironbark Wood
3.desc: Among the toughest hardwoods, it is extremely dense and impervious, with a nearly unbreakable outer bark.

4.name: Heartcore Wood
4.desc: The mystical essence derived from the most ancient of treants.

5.name: Enchanted Wood
5.desc: Almost forgotten mythical wood from the Elder Tree that predate civilization.

6.name: Rough Stone
6.desc: Small stone pieces commonly found along riverbanks and paths.

7.name: Marker Stone
7.desc: Upright stones marking paths and boundaries since ancient times.

8.name: Stream Fish
8.desc: Small, bountiful fish teeming in babbling streams and rivers.

9.name: Marsh Fish
9.desc: Robust, hardy fish scavenged from stagnant marsh waters.

10.name: Iron Ore
10.desc: A common ferrous ore that can be smelted into useful iron metals.

11.name: Copper Ore
11.desc: Reddish-brown ore that yields a soft, conductive copper metal.

12.name: Common Wheat
12.desc: Common wheat varieties grown on farms and in fields.

13.name: Golden Wheat
13.desc: Hardy wheat thriving on sloped ridges and knolls.

14.name: Wild Berries
14.desc: Basic, tangled handfuls of assorted common berries from the wild.

15.name: Bramble Berries
15.desc: Larger hauls of berries plucked from thick brambles.

16.name: Wildfur
16.desc: Prized for its natural warmth and durability.

17.name: Sharp Claw
17.desc: The natural weapon of natural predators.

18.name: Beginner Wood Axe
18.desc: A small and old wood axe used for chopping some common logs.

19.name: Novice Wood Axe
19.desc: A heavy wood axe, but prone to break.

20.name: Beginner Hammer
20.desc: Starter stone hammer with a balanced, light head for easy handling.

21.name: Novice Hammer
21.desc: Enhanced stone hammer which is designed for longer use with less fatigue.

22.name: Beginner Fishing Rod
22.desc: Simple design, perfect for catching small fish.

23.name: Novice Fishing Rod
23.desc: A balanced blend of durability and flexibility, made for catching small-to-medium fish.

24.name: Beginner Pickaxe
24.desc: A dull and old pickaxe for common ores and minerals.

25.name: Novice Pickaxe
25.desc: A standard pickaxe used by miners throughout the four Kingdoms.

26.name: Beginner Sickle
26.desc: A rusty sickle, only capable of harvesting the most basic wheat.

27.name: Novice Sickle
27.desc: Balanced and lightweight with better grip for efficient wheat cutting.

28.name: Beginner Berry Shears
28.desc: Gentle on berries, ideal for beginners learning to forage.

29.name: Novice Berry Shears
29.desc: Improved design for quick and easy collection of medium-sized berries.

30.name: Rusty Sword
30.desc: An old sword that was left to rust. It's visibly deteriorating, but it's still better than your fists.

31.name: Iron Sword
31.desc: Balanced for quick strikes, with an iron composition for durability.

32.name: Composite Bow
32.desc: An old and dusty bow that's only good at hitting small creatures.

33.name: Hunting Bow
33.desc: A basic hunting bow - plain, yet versatile.

35.name: Small Healing Potion
35.desc: A small potion that restores a small amount of health. Ideal for quick recovery during early adventures.

36.name: Draconic Heart
36.desc: It is said that a dragon's soul persists in its heart after death. The heart is still pulsing, albeit faintly.

37.name: Red Scales
37.desc: Crimson dragon scales, said to be nigh-indestructible, and of course, incredibly valuable.

38.name: Dragon Fang
38.desc: A massive and sharp fang, imbued with the dragon's ferocity.

39.name: Beast Piercer
39.desc: A vicious piercing spear edged with a dragon's lethal fang.

40.name: Blood Armor
40.desc: A vicious piercing spear edged with a dragon's lethal fang.

41.name: Scaled Greatshield
41.desc: A towering shield adorned with dragon scales, providing effective defense.

42.name: Standard Wood Axe
42.desc: The well-balanced woodcutter's axe for harvesting various types of timber.
